page.title: 06EDUCATION IN EAGLESFIELD
page.content: Children between the age of five and twelve go to the village primary {school.}The present building stands on the site of the original schoolmasters house, the original school now being used as a dining annexe.Midday meals are sent by van from the kitchens in Hoddom Primary School.A new toilet block has been built to replace the old one in the playground. There are three{teachers}and fifty four children at present.The curriculum covered by the permanent staff is augmented by peripatetic teachers for music,art and physical education.The school{choir}recently came second in the Dumfries Music Festival.The pupils are also given opportunities to take part in activities such as swimming and orienteering. Secondary{education}is provided at Lockerbie Academy.
